properties.Title: Tropical Cyclone Information Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: For Post-tropical Storm Humberto. The next information statement will be issued by 09:00 a.m. ADT. Gale to storm force winds have moved into the Scotian slope waters and will spread to the southern Grand banks later today. 1. Summary of basic information at 03:00 a.m. ADT. Location: Near 40.6 North 58.0 West. About 400 kilometres south-southeast of Sable Island. Maximum sustained winds: 140 kilometres per hour. Present movement: North-northeast at 32 kilometres per hour. Minimum central pressure: 970 millibars. 2. Public weather impacts and warnings summary. No significant effects are expected over land. a. Wind. No significant wind expected. b. Rainfall. Heavy bands of showers will approach and may reach portions of the Avalon Peninsula as Post-Tropical Storm Humberto tracks across the Grand Banks tonight and early Saturday morning. c. Surge/Waves. Swells of 2 to 3 metres will reach the Atlantic coast of Nova Scotia this morning, and 3 to 5 metre swells will then reach southern Newfoundland tonight and early Saturday. Waves will break higher along some areas of the coastline, and dangerous rip currents are possible. 3. Marine weather impacts and warnings summary. Storm warnings are in effect for East Scotian Slope - eastern half, Laurentian Fan, Southwestern Grand Banks and Southeastern Grand Banks. Gales warnings are in effect for Sable - eastern half, East Scotian Slope - western half, Banquereau - southern half, Northeast Coast and East Coast of Newfoundland, Funk Island bank and the Northern Grand Banks. Gale to Storm Force winds are forecast over East Scotian Slope, Laurentian Fan, Banquereau, and the southern Grand Banks today into Saturday. Hurricane force gusts are expected just south of the track this morning. Large waves of 7 to 10 metres will build over offshore waters today and tonight. Some of these waves could exceed 10 metres southeast of the track as the centre passes over Laurentian Fan and the southern Grand Banks. Forecaster(s): Hatt. ### Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-09-21T11:35:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T05:36:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1224286187.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorm activity will spread northeastwards across southeastern Saskatchewan into western Manitoba tonight. Some of these thunderstorms will likely be severe, capable of damaging hail, strong winds, and torrential rainfall. The activity will weaken later Friday morning, but another round of severe thunderstorm activity will develop later in the day, potentially impacting far southeastern Saskatchewan into southern Manitoba. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-20T17:07:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T08:45:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3470641629.2019

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong westerly winds with gusts up to 100 km/h will develop late this evening in the Canada Bay area. These winds are expected to diminish below warning criteria by early Friday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-20T11:14:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T03:37:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1962499572.2019
Area: Northern Peninsula East
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for the formation of frost tonight, especially in low lying inland areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-20T14:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T03:37:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2019262170.2019
Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:07 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. A line of severe thunderstorms is located from the Kelso area southwards to the Parkman area. These thunderstorms are moving northeast at approximately 60 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-09-20T11:06:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T08:08:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0692474753.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Scattered thunderstorms will move across portions of central Saskatchewan tonight. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe with main hazards of large hail and strong wind gusts. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
